newsitem.title: CANADA: Falconbridge union votes for strike mandate.
newsitem.headline: Falconbridge union votes for strike mandate.

text.p: Falconbridge Ltd's 1,400 unionized mine workers at its Sudbury, Ontario operations voted 91.28 percent in favor of giving their negotiating team a strike mandate to use in contract talks, the union said on Tuesday.

A spokeswoman for Canadian Auto Workers union local 598 told Reuters that the current contract expires on August 1, 1997 and that union members regularly give their negotiators a strike mandate to strengthen their bargaining position.
Falconbridge's chief negotiator said he was optimistic the nickel miner could reach an agreement with its Sudbury workers without a strike.
"Our plan is to be done on time and with a contract," Falconbridge director of human resources Gerald Foley said.
Falconbridge produced 42,100 tonnes of nickel out of Sudbury last year, less than half its total nickel production of 92,000 tonnes, along with 48,800 tonnes of copper and 730 tonnes of cobalt.
